ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained an overview of the history of Brazil and Brazilian historiography, which was crucial to my program of study. I learned about different historiographical techniques as well.
A familiarity with the main issues across a complete sweep of Brazilian history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Since this was a small seminar class with many auditors, perhaps the discussion could be a little deepened with more students reading for a grade. That said, even amongst the auditors the engagement with the material was high, and discussion was always very informative. Professor Schwartz is a deep well of fascinating information, and I am delighted that I got to study with him this semester.
We had good discussions in class and got a good sense of the field.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Professor Schwartz is rightly a world-renown scholar in this field, and it is an honor to work with him. Furthermore, he is highly approachable and invested in his students' well-being.
Yes because it was both informative and fun.
